head.supplied: List of the employese ¶ sic.Not all of the staff named have been identified.Those for whom details have been found have entries in the Biographical Register. ¶ ¶ in the Melbourne Botanical Gardens De...

div.p: V70/5248, unit 465, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

MS writtenbya clerk, with the annotations in a different hand.The file includes another sheet with a less complete list of names, and without the salaries and annotations. List originally registered as V70/4978 on 11 May 1870. List of the employese
sic .
Not all of the staff named have been identified .
Those for whom details have been found have entries in the Biographical Register .
in the Melbourne Botanical Gardens Department that have been discharged and those that are retained with there respective length of service.

William Smith 1

cell.p:
Mr Luhmann4
i.e. Luehmann.
The footnote reference number '4'
has been misplaced;
it refers to George Robertson the
engine driver, who was discharged
(see G. Robertson to M, 10 May 1870 (in this edition as 70-05-10a)).

cell.p: 3 Carter (his place to be taken by junior) one cart only required

note.p: Rows for notes 5 and 6 bracketed at right of column.

cell.style: border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: 5 Understood he was about to leave

cell.style: border-top: 0.0069in solid #000000; border-left: none; border-bottom: none; border-right: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;

border: none; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p: 6 purposes to tack his duties on to another man who is 5 yrs his senior

div.p:
The following text is linked to the bracketed notes by a line at the side of the page.
can be retained yetif C.S.
Chief Secretary.
desires
